div.p: Allergy/Intolerance resources are used to provide information about adverse sensitivities to substances. An adverse sensitivity is defined as: A condition expected to result in undesirable physiologic reaction to an amount of a substance that would not produce a reaction in most individuals.
Most of the details of the sensitivity can be found in the set of reactions that are associated with the resource.
Adverse Reactions do not have to be always associated with an AllergyIntolerance. This would usually be done when an individual reaction has not provided enough evidence for an Allergy/Intolerance.
